content: **"Permanent Disablement"** means a disability falling under one of the items of disablement listed in the scale of compensation in this Policy under Section 1, which was caused by an Accident, as long as the disability lasts for twelve (12) consecutive months from the date of the Accident and at the expiry of that period our appointed Registered Medical Practitioner confirms that the disability is not going to improve after twelve (12) months.
questions: How does the policy define Permanent Disablement in terms of the required duration of disability, the role of the appointed Registered Medical Practitioner, and the necessity of the disability being caused by an Accident?
What conditions must be met regarding the timing and confirmation of a disability for it to qualify as Permanent Disablement under this policy?
In what way does the policy link the scale of compensation under Section 1 to the classification of Permanent Disablement?
How does the policy address the situation where a disability lasts for less than twelve consecutive months following an Accident?
What is the significance of the twelve consecutive months period in establishing Permanent Disablement, and how does the medical confirmation at the end of this period affect claim eligibility?
How does the policy ensure that only disabilities caused by an Accident are considered for Permanent Disablement benefits?
What role does the appointed Registered Medical Practitioner play in confirming the permanence of a disability, and what happens if such confirmation is not obtained?
How does the policy treat disabilities that improve after twelve months despite initially lasting the full twelve months?
If a disability falls under the scale of compensation but is not confirmed as permanent by the appointed medical practitioner, how does that affect the claim for Permanent Disablement?
How does the policy define the starting point for the twelve consecutive months period required for Permanent Disablement eligibility?

How might the scale of compensation under Section 1 influence the amount payable for Permanent Disablement claims?
